alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 5:27PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 715 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM HST, radar continued to show a band of moderate to heavy showers falling at rates of up to an inch per hour over southeast and south slopes of Maui near Kihei, Wailea, and Ulupalakua. Additional rain is expected into the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Kula, Keokea, Pukalani, Makawao, Haliimaile, Keanae, Huelo, Haiku-Pauwela, Kipahulu, Kaupo, Nahiku, Pauwela, Paia, Makena, Puunene and Maalaea. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 715 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
